Sustainable and Cost-Efficient SENNEBOGEN Machine Transport via Water Route ğŸŒâš“

Our recent shipment of eight large SENNEBOGEN machines from Straubing to South Carolina via eco-friendly waterway marks another step toward sustainable logistics at SENNEBOGEN. ğŸƒ

A total of 700 tons of machinery was loaded onto barges at the port of Straubing. ğŸš¢ Among them were the powerful SENNEBOGEN 855 and 870 material handlers, weighing between 70 and 105 tons. The complex loading process involved precise tandem lifts, performed with a SENNEBOGEN 5500 E Crawler Crane, working in tandem with another crane.

The machines are now traveling via inland and ocean vessels to their final destination in Charleston, South Carolina. ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ This water route cuts COâ‚‚ emissions by 75%, saving 49 tons compared to road transport. âœ…

Restoration of historic SENNEBOGEN machines - former apprentice project with a success story ğŸ”§
Our employees Andreas and Alois started their career at SENNEBOGEN with an extraordinary project: the restoration of historical machines for the opening of the Erich Sennebogen Museum in 2014. âœ¨ 
One of these machines was a SENNEBOGEN S 802 rope excavator, in production between 1958 and 1960. After so many decades, the wear and tear of time had taken a heavy toll on the machine, which had to be dismantled and painstakingly restored. Alongside other historical models, all restored to their former glory, it is a witness to the development of mechanical engineering in our company's history. ğŸ‘
Ten years after the museum opened, Andreas and Alois are still part of our team and have made impressive careers since then. ğŸš€
ğŸ’¡Read more here: â¡ï¸ https://bit.ly/3Assyxo

Restaurierung historischer SENNEBOGEN Maschinen - ehemaliges Azubiprojekt mit Erfolgsgeschichte ğŸ”§
Unsere Mitarbeiter Andreas und Alois starteten ihre Karriere bei SENNEBOGEN mit einem auÃŸergewÃ¶hnlichen Projekt: der Restaurierung historischer Maschinen zur ErÃ¶ffnung des Erich Sennebogen Museums um 2014. âœ¨ 
Eine dieser Maschinen war ein SENNEBOGEN S 802 Seilbagger, in Produktion zwischen 1958 und 1960. Nach so vielen Jahrzehnten hatte der Zahn der Zeit stark an der Maschine genagt, welche  zerlegt und in mÃ¼hevoller Detailarbeit restauriert werden musste. Im Museum in Straubing zeugt sie seit der Aufbereitung in neuer Pracht neben anderen historischen Modellen von der Entwicklung des Maschinenbaus in der Unternehmensgeschichte. ğŸ‘
Auch Andreas und Alois sind zehn Jahre nach MuseumserÃ¶ffnung immer noch Teil unseres Teams und haben seitdem beeindruckende Karrieren gemacht. ğŸš€
